\begin{document}
While EM is not the focus of this thesis, a brief description of the
procedure as given in Bishop Ch 9 \cite{bishop2006pattern} is provided
for the sake of completeness.
\begin{enumerate}
\item Initialise the $\mu_{k},\Sigma_{k},\pi_{k}$ to reasonable values,
commonly a simple clustering algorithm such as K-means is chosen. 
\item Expectation Step (Holding parameters constant)
\begin{align*}
\gamma_{k}^{new} & =\frac{\pi_{k}^{old}\mathcal{N}(\mathbf{x}|\mu_{k}^{old},\Sigma_{k}^{old})}{\sum_{j=1}^{K}\pi_{j}^{old}\mathcal{N}(\mathbf{x}|\mu_{j}^{old},\Sigma_{j}^{old})}
\end{align*}

\item Maximisation (Holding latent variable constant)
\begin{align*}
\mu_{k}^{new}= & \frac{1}{N_{k}}\sum_{n=1}^{N}\mathbf{x}_{n}\gamma_{nk}\\
\Sigma_{k}^{new}= & \frac{1}{N_{k}}\sum_{n=1}^{N}\gamma_{nk}(\mathbf{x}_{n}-\mu_{k}^{new})(\mathbf{x}_{n}-\mu_{k}^{new})^{T}\\
\pi_{k}^{new}= & N_{k}/N
\end{align*}

\item Evaluate the likelihood with the new parameters and check if the likelihood
has converged. Until then, repeat the Expectation and Maximisation
steps.\end{enumerate}

\end{document}
